column4: hey guys im trying to start the sshd (sudo /etc/init.d/ssh start) and it says it fails
any ideas why?
guys ssh isn't starting when i type sudo /etc/init.d/ssh start
it just fails, there isn't any output so i cant tell whats wrong
look at logs.
in /var/log/
/var/log/syslog
hm. type: echo "*.* -/var/log/all.log" | sudo tee -a /etc/syslog.conf
than sudo touch /var/log/all.log and sudo /etc/init.d/sysklogd restart
than tail -f /var/log/all.log and sudo /etc/init.d/ssh restart
sudo lsof -ni 4 | grep -i listen | grep ssh
it'll attach to file and look for new messages.
what that line with lsof gives you?
yes run it. it will tell you, what's is attached to port 22 (ssh)
sudo lsof -ni 4 | grep -i listen | grep ssh
ok. start ssh. what's exact message? paste it on my priv.
and what is in all.log?
great. and paste your .ssh/id_dsa there ;P
or use pastebin.com afair
and you've spoiled my irc support joke, huh ;(
sudo killall sshd ; sudo /etc/init.d/sshd start . as you see in your logs ssh was running well.
yes. read (but _DO_NOT_ paste) the logs.
i think that you've started it twice or more. and no type: sudo lsof -ni4 | grep -i listen | grep ssh
and paste the effect to me! (1st /query Shufla)
